Package frc.team1711.swerve.util

Class InputHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • frc.team1711.swerve.util.InputHandler
  • public class InputHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a system for converting continuous user input into a usable input into robot-control functions.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  InputHandler.Curve
      A functional interface which represents an input curve, useful for allowing for better control at certain input magnitudes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      InputHandler​(double inputDeadband)
      Creates a new InputHandler given a specified deadband.
      InputHandler​(double inputDeadband, InputHandler.Curve inputCurve)
      Creates a new InputHandler given a specified deadband and input curve.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double apply​(double input)
      Gets the output of the input handler, after applying both the given input deadband and the input curve.
      Vector apply​(Vector input)
      Maps an input vector according to the mechanics of apply(double), based on the magnitude of the vector.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • InputHandler

        public InputHandler​(double inputDeadband,
                    InputHandler.Curve inputCurve)
        Creates a new InputHandler given a specified deadband and input curve.
        Parameters:
        inputDeadband - A minimum input value for which the input should be considered nonzero. The input will be scaled around the deadband such that arbitrarily low outputs can be reached by inputting values just above the deadband. Primarily used to combat stick drift. Should be on the interval [0, 1).
        inputCurve - The InputHandler.Curve used to convert input values (after applying the deadband) to output values.

      • InputHandler

        public InputHandler​(double inputDeadband)
        Creates a new InputHandler given a specified deadband. Other than the deadband, the mapping of input to output is linear.
        Parameters:
        inputDeadband - A minimum input value for which the input should be considered nonzero. The input will be scaled around the deadband such that arbitrarily low outputs can be reached by inputting values just above the deadband. Primarily used to combat stick drift. Should be on the interval [0, 1).

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public final double apply​(double input)
        Gets the output of the input handler, after applying both the given input deadband and the input curve.
        Parameters:
        input - The input value, on the interval [-1, 1]
        Returns:
        The corresponding output value, on the interval [-1, 1]
        See Also:
        apply(Vector)

      • apply

        public final Vector apply​(Vector input)
        Maps an input vector according to the mechanics of apply(double), based on the magnitude of the vector.
        Parameters:
        input - The input vector, with a magnitude on the interval [-1, 1]
        Returns:
        The corresponding output vector, with a magnitude on the interval [-1, 1]
